description: Entertainment industry claims: streaming, box office, music, gaming

cases.claim: Netflix maintained global streaming market share leadership in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Netflix held 23% of global streaming revenue share in 2023; nearest rival at 12%
Netflix reached 260M subscribers by Q4 2023, up from 231M in Q4 2022

cases.claim: Global box office fully recovered to pre-pandemic levels in 2023
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: 2023 global box office reached $33.9B vs $42.5B in 2019 (80% recovery)
China and India showed strong recovery; North America lagged at 78%

cases.claim: AI-generated music will account for 10% of streaming by 2025
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: AI-generated tracks grew from <0.1% to ~1% of Spotify uploads in 2023
Major labels actively removing AI content; legal battles ongoing

cases.claim: Video games generated more revenue than film and music combined in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Gaming revenue: $187B (Newzoo); Global box office: $33.9B; Recorded music: $28.6B
Mobile gaming alone at $92B exceeded both film and music combined

cases.claim: Podcast listenership peaked in 2022 and is now declining
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Edison Research: monthly podcast listeners grew from 62% to 64% of US 12+ in 2023
Spotify podcast hours consumed grew 20% YoY in 2023

cases.claim: The 2023 WGA strike cost the entertainment industry over $5 billion
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Milken Institute estimated $6.5B total economic impact to California alone
148-day strike caused delays to 60+ TV series and 20+ film productions

cases.claim: Vinyl record sales surpassed CD sales for the first time since the 1980s
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: RIAA: vinyl revenue $1.2B vs CDs $800M in US for 2023
Vinyl has outsold CDs by revenue since 2020; unit sales also flipped in 2023

cases.claim: Live theater attendance in Broadway exceeded pre-pandemic levels in 2023
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Broadway grossed $1.58B in 2022-23 season vs $1.83B in 2018-19
Attendance was 12.3M vs 14.8M pre-pandemic

cases.claim: Consumers are experiencing streaming subscription fatigue, reducing to 3 or fewer services
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Deloitte survey: avg US household subscribes to 4 services, down from 5 in 2022; 44% say too expensive
Churn rates increased to 6% monthly across major platforms

cases.claim: K-Pop is the fastest-growing music genre globally
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: K-Pop streaming grew 27% YoY; Afrobeats grew 41%, Latin urbano 33%
K-Pop concert revenue growth was 55% YoY, highest of any genre

cases.claim: Ad-supported streaming tiers attracted over 50 million subscribers combined by 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Netflix ad tier: 23M monthly active users; Disney+: 16M; Peacock: 28M (with overlap)
Ad-supported viewing hours grew 150% YoY across platforms

cases.claim: TikTok has become the primary music discovery platform for Gen Z
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: 75% of Gen Z discover new music on TikTok vs 24% on radio
67% of TikTok viral songs entered Billboard Hot 100 within 8 weeks

cases.claim: Superhero movies are experiencing diminishing returns at the box office
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: MCU 2023 films averaged $500M vs $800M+ pre-pandemic average
DC's Flash ($268M) and Blue Beetle ($129M) significantly underperformed

cases.claim: Reality TV viewership has declined as audiences shift to scripted streaming content
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Reality TV accounted for 55% of broadcast primetime ratings in 2023, up from 48%
Love Island, Survivor, and Below Deck all hit multi-season highs

cases.claim: Live music revenue hit an all-time record in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Global live music revenue reached $32.7B in 2023, surpassing 2019's $28.9B
Taylor Swift Eras Tour alone grossed $1B+, the first concert tour to do so

cases.claim: The esports industry contracted in 2023 as investor interest waned
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Esports revenue dropped 7% to $1.38B; multiple orgs folded or downsized
VC funding for esports fell 75% from 2021 peak

cases.claim: Audiobook sales grew faster than any other book format in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Audiobook revenue grew 10% to $2.3B in US; ebooks grew 1%, print declined 2%
Spotify audiobook launches expanded market by 25% in select regions

cases.claim: AI deepfake videos of celebrities doubled every quarter in 2023
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Sensity AI detected 96K new deepfake celebrity videos in 2023, up from 35K in 2022
Growth was substantial but not consistently doubling each quarter

cases.claim: Anime has become a mainstream entertainment category in the West
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Crunchyroll surpassed 13M paid subscribers globally in 2023
Anime films held 4 of top-20 global box office spots in 2023

cases.claim: Trust in traditional news media fell to an all-time low in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Edelman Trust Barometer: 47% trust traditional media in 2023, lowest recorded
Reuters Institute: 36% actively avoid news, up from 29% in 2017
